conclusion: Solve step-by-step to find maximum distance between vehicles during braking.
Truck starts at 40 m/s, bus starts at 30 m/s, both decelerate linearly, reach same velocity at t = 10s, truck stops at t = 20s, bus stops at t = 30s.
Truck deceleration rate is 2 m/s², bus deceleration rate is 1 m/s².
Initially, bus is 30 meters ahead of truck.
At t = 0s, distance between truck and bus is 30 meters.
At t = 10s, truck position is 300 meters, bus position is 280 meters, truck is ahead by 20 meters.
Truck is ahead of bus and both are decelerating, distance will increase until one stops.
Maximum distance occurs when truck stops at t = 20s.
At t = 20s, truck position is 400 meters, bus position is 430 meters, bus is ahead by 30 meters.
Recalculate positions from initial position of truck.
Using kinematic equations, truck position is x_truck = 40t - t², bus position is x_bus = 30 + 30t - 0.5t².
Differentiate d(t) and set to zero, t = 10s.
At t = 10s, distance is -20 meters, truck is ahead by 20 meters.
Maximum distance is 30 meters at t = 0s.
Final answer: Maximum distance is 30 meters at initial moment t = 0s.
